pros: Great support from supervisors and co-workers, with true teamwork. Excellent benefits and vacation days, flexible 4-day work week. Good communication regarding Case Management Redesign
cons: Since covid, high turnover but in recent months has gotten better. Nature of work can be stressful

review_title: Feel good about the work I do everyday!
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Lakewood, CO
pros: DDRC is a fantastic employer and gives me the opportunity to bring a smile to someone's face everyday. I love going to work and look forward to Monday's.
cons: The pay can be low but I know Senior Management is always trying to keep our wages competitive.

pros: Client families were understanding and a pleasure to work with.
cons: You are not paid as much

pros: the employee benefits are incomparable
cons: everything else is a con

job_title: Direct Service Provider in Charlotte, NC
pros: The company provides a great deal of support, especially from the QPs. There is always open communication from the office to the staff out in the community.
cons: The biggest con is that you are considered an independent contractor. There aren't any raises, in fact at one point money was taken away. You are responsible for making sure you take your taxes out.

pros: You will meet some incredible people!
cons: Low pay, difficult management, high turnover, outdated IT systems, and poor communication between departments.

pros:
People working for families in need of help. Flexible schedule.
Benefits.
cons:
Heavy caseload wasn't able to help the families and individuals as much as I would have liked due to not enough time with each of them too big of a case load. 
Pay.

pros: Feel good about what you do, day in and day out. Medical benefits are top notch. Board and Senior Management care about employee's.
cons: Sometimes hours are long and we're under staffed. However, that's the case everywhere. I really enjoy working at DDRC

job_title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) in Lakewood, CO
pros: 4 day work week, so good work/life balance.
cons: Favoritism within upper management. If they dont like you, you dont grow within the company

pros: None, this organization is going down hill

pros: great training and support. Love the staff and clients
cons: I really didn't find any cons. I left for personal reasons

pros: Great benefits, quality leadership, 4 day work week, meaningful work, professional environment. I learned a lot working for DDRC.  Amazing work life balance for Resource Coordinators. Job is low stress if you are organized.
cons: Low pay. Also, the service provider part of organization needs to catch up to modern service delivery. The day programs could provide more opportunities for inclusion.

pros:
DDRC is a family not just an employer.
Staff are supported in their professional growth and administration always has an open door.  They offer superb care to consumers.
cons: I have to write 20 words and I have no cons to report. They just do a great job for staff and consumers.

pros: Flexible schedule, ample vacation time, 3 day weekend, excellent health benefits, great leadership overall.
cons: Low(er) pay, male supervisors micro manage, when taking a vacation you end up doing the same amount of work in shorter time, few opportunities for advancement, no regular raises.

pros: There are some quality people working for this place. The consumers are a pleasure to work with every day. Opportunities are there for those that pursue them.
cons: Some people are clearly burnt out.
